availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Executive Journal, 1859-1862

body.p:
26
The Governor approved an account of $136 25/100 to Robt A. Seay expenses &c for arresting a Fugitive from Justice.
Also an account for $50 for publication of proclamation convening the General Assembly
Also accounts to E. H. Tole amounting to $40.60/100 for work done oin Senate & House of Representatives Hall all duly certified as Correct.
He appointed the following Notaries Public for Webster county G. C. Gaines, H L. Woolfork, John Brooks & W. T. Vaughan
He issued a Requistion on Tennessee for the apprehension of Wm Shriver chared by Indictment in the Jefferson Circuit Court and appointed D. T. Bligh Agent.
He remitted the following Judgments, to wit:

row.cell: Floyd Cir. Ct. vs W. Adams

body.p:
Jany 26
The Governor pardoned Robt Harris convicted of felony by the Jefferson Circuit Court and sentenced to three years confinement in the Penitintiary
He approved and signed enrolled Bills Chapters 6. 7. & 8
